intro: Raillardella paniculata, commonly known as the showy raillardella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, preferring moist, sandy soils. It produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Raillardella paniculata is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
